question.questionText: The motors shown at the right with the D-cell batteries will NOT run. Explain why.

referenceAnswers.referenceAnswer: The negative terminals of the D-cell batteries are facing each other, so there is no flow of electricity.

studentAnswers.studentAnswer: They will not run because electricity flows from negative to positive and on here it is negative to negative.
They will not run because the batteries have to be facing the same direction, negative to positive.
They will not run because negative is pointing to negative.
The motors will not run because they do not have negative they only have positives.
